name: Amanda Levine
education: BA in Marketing, University of Miami (2002 - 2006)

responsibilities: Produced Dell Technologies Mobile Tour with 70+ stops in the US and Canada.
Managed tour logistics including theme, route, swag, branding, content, and staffing.
Oversaw a $2.3M budget and secured permits for outdoor venues.
Produced YouTube Shorts community events in major cities, managing budgets up to $200K per event.

experience.location: Park City, UT and New York
responsibilities: Produced high-end, COVID-safe events for VIP clients.
Strategized event calendars to maximize press and media interactions.
Managed logistics including venues, catering, vendors, and budgets.
Produced global events for 1,000+ clients across multiple international locations.
Collaborated with cross-functional teams to deliver cohesive branding.
Managed budgets up to $5M and negotiated contracts to maximize ROI.
Produced wellness programs and events for The Chopra Center.
Managed all wellness programming at Gurney’s Montauk.
Utilized sponsors to enhance brand and social awareness.
Produced corporate media events with budgets ranging from $50K to $800K.
Collaborated with high-level officials to ensure event success.
Managed onsite logistics including scenery, catering, and transportation.
Produced over 50 events annually in multiple venues.
Coordinated client needs regarding rentals, staffing, and logistics.
Managed event staffing and facilitated on-site meetings.
Produced corporate, private, and fundraising events from start to finish.
Managed budgets and negotiated with vendors to stay within client budgets.
Led production meetings and coordinated technical, costume, and décor teams.
Managed development of promotional materials for the sales team.
Coordinated large networking events with high-profile speakers.
Created and distributed quarterly newsletters and email campaigns.

bio: I am an event producer with more than a decade of experience planning, managing, and delivering successful conferences, product launches, networking events, press briefings, and galas. I have produced events for corporations, non-profits, individuals, and charities such as the ALS Association. My charitable work has helped raise over $200,000 through golf outings and cocktail party fundraisers for research into the treatment and cure for Lou Gehrig’s Disease. Always seeking to learn and develop myself, I have achieved high-level leadership, financial, communication, and interpersonal skills. I dedicate myself to delivering events to the satisfaction and delight of my clients.
